member.name: T:ic4.WinForms.Dialogs
member.summary: Static class containing functions to show builtin dialogs

member.name: M:ic4.WinForms.Dialogs.ShowDeviceDialog(ic4.Grabber,System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary:
Shows a dialog that lets the user select a video capture device.
If the user selects a device, it is opened in the passed object.
member.param: A parent window for the dialog
member.returns: true if a device was opened successfully, otherwise false

member.name: M:ic4.WinForms.Dialogs.ShowDevicePropertyDialog(ic4.Grabber,System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window,ic4.WinForms.PropertyDialogFlags,System.String,System.String,ic4.PropertyVisibility,System.String)
member.summary:
Show a dialog to let the user configure the properties of the video capture device opened in .
If the user cancels the dialog, all properties are restored to the state they were in when the dialog was opened.
member.param: A grabber with an opened video capture device
A parent window for the dialog
Category of properties to show in the dialog
The title of the dialog. If null, a default title is set.
Pre-selects a property visibility in the property dialog's visibility selector.
Inserts a text into the property dialog's filter textbox.
member.returns: true if the dialog was displayed and exited using the OK button, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ic4.WinForms.Dialogs.ShowPropertyMapDialog(ic4.PropertyMap,System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window,ic4.WinForms.PropertyDialogFlags,System.String,System.String,ic4.PropertyVisibility,System.String)
member.summary:
Show a dialog to let the user configure properties in the passed .
If the user cancels the dialog, all properties are restored to the state they were in when the dialog was opened.
When displaying the of an opened video capture device (), this function does not allow changing certain properties when there is an active data stream. Use with to show a dialog that allows changing stream-defining properties.
member.param: A parent window for the dialog
Category of properties to show in the dialog
The title of the dialog. If null, a default title is set.
Pre-selects a property visibility in the property dialog's visibility selector.
Inserts a text into the property dialog's filter textbox.
member.returns: true if the dialog was displayed and exited using the OK button, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ic4.WinForms.Dialogs.ShowSelectDeviceDialog(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Shows a dialog that lets the user select a video capture device
member.param: A parent window for the dialog
member.returns: A object representing the video capture device that was selected, or null if the user did not select a device.

member.name: P:ic4.WinForms.Display.InternalHandle
member.summary: Handle for the display (internal use only)

member.name: M:ic4.WinForms.Display.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ic4.WinForms.Display.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Paints the control background in design mode

member.name: M:ic4.WinForms.Display.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:ic4.WinForms.PropertyDialogFlags
member.summary: Defines flags configuring the behavior of property dialog functions

member.name: F:ic4.WinForms.PropertyDialogFlags.AllowStreamRestart
member.summary:
Allows the user to change the value of device properties that would require a stream restart to do so.
The dialog will automatically restart the stream when one of those properties is changed.

member.name: F:ic4.WinForms.PropertyDialogFlags.RestoreStateOnCancel
member.summary: Instructs the dialog to initially save the state of all properties, and restore them to their original value if the dialog is closed using the Cancel button.

member.name: F:ic4.WinForms.PropertyDialogFlags.ShowTopCategory
member.summary: If set, the top-level category is displayed in the property tree view of the property dialog.

member.name: F:ic4.WinForms.PropertyDialogFlags.HideFilter
member.summary: If set, the dialog does not display the visibility dropdown and filter text box.
